column5: just wondering who's going out on sunday to binbrook for the derby?
Sinns & I are heading out there in the morning.
I know FishFarmer will be there. Me, I might come out with the dog for a walk about, we'll see.  If'n I do and you see this pup running about, give me holler.
I'll give ya a hollar if i see ya Spiel.....  Right this grl is going fishing......
Better wear your chest waders and PFD if you are going out on the ice after today. Safety first.
No offence but we have been building ice for the past 45 days,  It does not get destroyed in a day by 5 degree temps.  There is 12 to 15"of ice on binbrook if anyone is interested.
i'll be there!

Welcome to the board mjack7.  I was referring to the water that will be on top of the ice after today's melt. I'm sure the ice will still be there underneath a foot or so of water and slush. Looking forward to the report and pics tomorrow.

Make sure when you release the fish that they actually make it down the hole and not swimming on top of the ice...lol. Been there done that. Good luck to everyone and don't be surprized if there was more melting than you thought. Its not staying very cold at night and won't be for several days. Wear your float suits and rubbers, its gonna be soggy.
Seen a video on another site. I'll be wearing my high insulated rubber boots. The water slush looked 4 to 6" . Could ruin a good day with wet cold feet.
How did it go? Did any OFNCer's make it out?

Yup i made it out.......Was late getting there though allmost 10.30am as a few things unexpected popped up early am.....   But we still headed through and fished through till allmost 1.00pm....I had two bumps that was it.....Sinns did not even get a bump....A group of fellas to the left of us had got there early am and between six of them had 30 crappie.....But it pretty much died they said when we got there and left not long after we arrived......Because i did not fish the derby i was fishing the west side of the xmas trees away from the people that were fishin the tourney. We left around 1.00pm and headed to LPB and fished out of old cut through till 4.30pm.  I hope everyone did better than we did today...  Binbrook this morning.
it was a great day to hold the event. despite the sloppy conditions there was a huge turnout!!!! winning fish was 1.74lb crappie  caught at 9:08am.
Was a great day, I came in 3 rd place with a 0.90 and Crappie Steve came 2 nd with a 1.20 Crappie
so you were the guy that knocked me of the leader board eh ....hmmmmm LOL  congrats guys, i took 4th with a .88 crappie
Crappie Steve... how is the bugger..

He was on cloud 9,   he walked away with $175.00 cash and prizes. Their was a lot of OFC'ers in the derby. Winning fish got $1000.00 cash, plus prizes. I came 3rd. $75.00 Cash plus prizes. It was an excellent day Irish. Their was lots of room to land   to join in.

Wayne I'm doing fine bud,I remember that picture  pretIty well.Had a great day,like Fishfarmer mentioned came in 2cd place for adults,and with some fish too.I think Monique still has that prize LOL. Steve
Good hearing from you Steve, it's been awhile
WTG guys sounds like it was a fun event!
Good to see some OFC'ers on the podium.  Congrats to Fish Farmer & CrappieSteve.
